alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 12 at 4:32PM MDT until June 13 at 10:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE CROOKED CREEK BURN AREA REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Crooked Creek Burn Area. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following counties, Big Horn and Carbon. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Crooked Creek Burn Area is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
